column1: #Text=In this Vietnamese name , the family name is Hương .
#Text=According to Vietnamese custom , this person should properly be referred to by the given name Thanh .
#Text=Huong Thanh at the Musée Guimet , Paris , 2007
#Text=Hương Thanh is a Vietnamese singer of various genres , including Cai Luong and jazz fusion . [ 1 ]
#Text=In 2007 , France Musique honored her with the Musique du monde award .
#Text=Her early discography includes Chuyện ba người ( 1995 ) , Moon and Wind ( ACT Music , 1999 ) , and Tales from Vietnam , de Nguyên Lê ( ACT Music , 1996 ) .
#Text=Hương Thanh was born in Saigon to a family of South Vietnamese musicians .
#Text=Her father , Hữu Phước ( died 1997 ) , was a master of Cải lương singing . [ 1 ] [ 2 ]
#Text=She has at least one sibling , a sister , Hương Lan .
#Text=From the age of 10 , Huong was trained in Cải Lương and in traditional singing .
#Text=At the age of 14 , she studied at various schools of music and theater , and at 16 she gave her stage debut .
#Text=In 1977 , as a result of the political events in Vietnam , she emigrated to Paris at age 17 .
#Text=In 1995 , she met the Vietnamese guitarist Nguyên Lê , who was her first contact with jazz and world music .
#Text=In 1996 , she sang at the invitation of UNESCO to celebrate the anniversary of the Declaration of Human Rights .
#Text=With her sister , Hương Lan , she recorded in Los Angeles , California , US in 1997 . [ 1 ]
#Text=In the following years , she worked alongside Nguyên Lê with Michel Alibo , Paolo Fresu , Paul McCandless , and Dhafer Youssef .
#Text=The CD , Fragile Beauty , which was recorded in the duo with Nguyên Lê in 2007 , which was finished in the spring of 2008 in the World Music Charts Europe ( April 2nd place , May 4th place ) .
#Text=In 2007 , she received the Prix Musique des Musiques du Monde for her interpretation of the traditional music of Vietnam .
#Text=This prize is connected with studio recordings and in 2008 the CD Viet Nam was released : Musique Du Théâtre Cai Luong .
#Text=Here Huong , in collaboration with traditional musicians , interprets some of the most popular pieces of Cải lương and the traditional music of the three regions of Vietnam .
#Text=With this repertoire , she toured with her Huong Thanh Trio .
